paragraphs.content: Chapter 3
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 3

paragraphs.content: I am the man that hath seen affliction by the rod of his wrath.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I am the man that hath seen affliction by the rod of his wrath.

paragraphs.content: He hath led me, and brought me into darkness, but not into light.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He hath led me, and brought me into darkness, but not into light.

paragraphs.content: Surely against me is he turned; he turneth his hand against me all the day.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Surely against me is he turned; he turneth his hand against me all the day.

paragraphs.content: My flesh and my skin hath he made old; he hath broken my bones.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My flesh and my skin hath he made old; he hath broken my bones.

paragraphs.content: He hath builded against me, and compassed me with gall and travail.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He hath builded against me, and compassed me with gall and travail.

paragraphs.content: He hath set me in dark places, as they that be dead of old.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He hath set me in dark places, as they that be dead of old.

paragraphs.content: He hath hedged me about, that I cannot get out: he hath made my chain heavy.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He hath hedged me about, that I cannot get out: he hath made my chain heavy.

paragraphs.content: Also when I cry and shout, he shutteth out my prayer.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Also when I cry and shout, he shutteth out my prayer.

paragraphs.content: He hath inclosed my ways with hewn stone, he hath made my paths crooked.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He hath inclosed my ways with hewn stone, he hath made my paths crooked.

paragraphs.content: He was unto me as a bear lying in wait, and as a lion in secret places.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He was unto me as a bear lying in wait, and as a lion in secret places.

paragraphs.content: He hath turned aside my ways, and pulled me in pieces: he hath made me desolate.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He hath turned aside my ways, and pulled me in pieces: he hath made me desolate.

paragraphs.content: He hath bent his bow, and set me as a mark for the arrow.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He hath bent his bow, and set me as a mark for the arrow.

paragraphs.content: He hath caused the arrows of his quiver to enter into my reins.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He hath caused the arrows of his quiver to enter into my reins.

paragraphs.content: I was a derision to all my people; and their song all the day.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I was a derision to all my people; and their song all the day.

paragraphs.content: He hath filled me with bitterness, he hath made me drunken with wormwood.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He hath filled me with bitterness, he hath made me drunken with wormwood.

paragraphs.content: He hath also broken my teeth with gravel stones, he hath covered me with ashes.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He hath also broken my teeth with gravel stones, he hath covered me with ashes.

paragraphs.content: And thou hast removed my soul far off from peace: I forgat prosperity.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And thou hast removed my soul far off from peace: I forgat prosperity.

paragraphs.content: And I said, My strength and my hope is perished from the LORD:
paragraphs.contentHtml: And I said, My strength and my hope is perished from the Lord:

paragraphs.content: Remembering mine affliction and my misery, the wormwood and the gall.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Remembering mine affliction and my misery, the wormwood and the gall.

paragraphs.content: My soul hath them still in remembrance, and is humbled in me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My soul hath them still in remembrance, and is humbled in me.

paragraphs.content: This I recall to my mind, therefore have I hope.
paragraphs.contentHtml: This I recall to my mind, therefore have I hope.

paragraphs.content: ¶ It is of the LORD’s mercies that we are not consumed, because his compassions fail not.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ It is of the Lord’s mercies that we are not consumed, because his compassions fail not.

paragraphs.content: They are new every morning: great is thy faithfulness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They are new every morning: great is thy faithfulness.

paragraphs.content: The LORD is my portion, saith my soul; therefore will I hope in him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord is my portion, saith my soul; therefore will I hope in him.

paragraphs.content: The LORD is good unto them that wait for him, to the soul that seeketh him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord is good unto them that wait for him, to the soul that seeketh him.

paragraphs.content: It is good that a man should both hope and quietly wait for the salvation of the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: It is good that a man should both hope and quietly wait for the salvation of the Lord.

paragraphs.content: It is good for a man that he bear the yoke in his youth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: It is good for a man that he bear the yoke in his youth.

paragraphs.content: He sitteth alone and keepeth silence, because he hath borne it upon him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He sitteth alone and keepeth silence, because he hath borne it upon him.

paragraphs.content: He putteth his mouth in the dust; if so be there may be hope.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He putteth his mouth in the dust; if so be there may be hope.

paragraphs.content: He giveth his cheek to him that smiteth him: he is filled full with reproach.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He giveth his cheek to him that smiteth him: he is filled full with reproach.

paragraphs.content: For the Lord will not cast off for ever:
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the Lord will not cast off for ever:

paragraphs.content: But though he cause grief, yet will he have compassion according to the multitude of his mercies.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But though he cause grief, yet will he have compassion according to the multitude of his mercies.

paragraphs.content: For he doth not afflict willingly nor grieve the children of men.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For he doth not afflict willingly nor grieve the children of men.

paragraphs.content: To crush under his feet all the prisoners of the earth,
paragraphs.contentHtml: To crush under his feet all the prisoners of the earth,

paragraphs.content: To turn aside the right of a man before the face of the most High,
paragraphs.contentHtml: To turn aside the right of a man before the face of the most High,

paragraphs.content: To subvert a man in his cause, the Lord approveth not.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To subvert a man in his cause, the Lord approveth not.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Who is he that saith, and it cometh to pass, when the Lord commandeth it not?
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Who is he that saith, and it cometh to pass, when the Lord commandeth it not?

paragraphs.content: Out of the mouth of the most High proceedeth not evil and good?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Out of the mouth of the most High proceedeth not evil and good?

paragraphs.content: Wherefore doth a living man complain, a man for the punishment of his sins?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wherefore doth a living man complain, a man for the punishment of his sins?

paragraphs.content: Let us search and try our ways, and turn again to the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let us search and try our ways, and turn again to the Lord.

paragraphs.content: Let us lift up our heart with our hands unto God in the heavens.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let us lift up our heart with our hands unto God in the heavens.

paragraphs.content: We have transgressed and have rebelled: thou hast not pardoned.
paragraphs.contentHtml: We have transgressed and have rebelled: thou hast not pardoned.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast covered with anger, and persecuted us: thou hast slain, thou hast not pitied.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast covered with anger, and persecuted us: thou hast slain, thou hast not pitied.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast covered thyself with a cloud, that our prayer should not pass through.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast covered thyself with a cloud, that our prayer should not pass through.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast made us as the offscouring and refuse in the midst of the people.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast made us as the offscouring and refuse in the midst of the people.

paragraphs.content: All our enemies have opened their mouths against us.
paragraphs.contentHtml: All our enemies have opened their mouths against us.

paragraphs.content: Fear and a snare is come upon us, desolation and destruction.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Fear and a snare is come upon us, desolation and destruction.

paragraphs.content: Mine eye runneth down with rivers of water for the destruction of the daughter of my people.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Mine eye runneth down with rivers of water for the destruction of the daughter of my people.

paragraphs.content: Mine eye trickleth down, and ceaseth not, without any intermission,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Mine eye trickleth down, and ceaseth not, without any intermission,

paragraphs.content: Till the LORD look down, and behold from heaven.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Till the Lord look down, and behold from heaven.

paragraphs.content: Mine eye affecteth mine heart because of all the daughters of my city.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Mine eye affecteth mine heart because of all the daughters of my city.

paragraphs.content: Mine enemies chased me sore, like a bird, without cause.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Mine enemies chased me sore, like a bird, without cause.

paragraphs.content: They have cut off my life in the dungeon, and cast a stone upon me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They have cut off my life in the dungeon, and cast a stone upon me.

paragraphs.content: Waters flowed over mine head; then I said, I am cut off.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Waters flowed over mine head; then I said, I am cut off.

paragraphs.content: ¶ I called upon thy name, O LORD, out of the low dungeon.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ I called upon thy name, O Lord, out of the low dungeon.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast heard my voice: hide not thine ear at my breathing, at my cry.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast heard my voice: hide not thine ear at my breathing, at my cry.

paragraphs.content: Thou drewest near in the day that I called upon thee: thou saidst, Fear not.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou drewest near in the day that I called upon thee: thou saidst, Fear not.

paragraphs.content: O Lord, thou hast pleaded the causes of my soul; thou hast redeemed my life.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O Lord, thou hast pleaded the causes of my soul; thou hast redeemed my life.

paragraphs.content: O LORD, thou hast seen my wrong: judge thou my cause.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O Lord, thou hast seen my wrong: judge thou my cause.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast seen all their vengeance and all their imaginations against me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast seen all their vengeance and all their imaginations against me.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast heard their reproach, O LORD, and all their imaginations against me;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast heard their reproach, O Lord, and all their imaginations against me;

paragraphs.content: The lips of those that rose up against me, and their device against me all the day.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The lips of those that rose up against me, and their device against me all the day.

paragraphs.content: Behold their sitting down, and their rising up; I am their musick.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold their sitting down, and their rising up; I am their musick.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Render unto them a recompence, O LORD, according to the work of their hands.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Render unto them a recompence, O Lord, according to the work of their hands.

paragraphs.content: Give them sorrow of heart, thy curse unto them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Give them sorrow of heart, thy curse unto them.

paragraphs.content: Persecute and destroy them in anger from under the heavens of the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Persecute and destroy them in anger from under the heavens of the Lord.
